history.content: I've taken both. I think 162 projects are more difficult than 164 (friendlier debugging tools). In terms of usefulness, 162 is much more useful than 164 IMO. In 162, you start thinking of concurrency and you will easily see how a design fails if you don't consider how it will operate in the context of concurrency. I think this thought alone makes the class worthwhile. In terms of class difficulty, you'll probably have to work harder in 164 because the class is much more self-selective than 162, so midterms/finals will be competitive.

children.subject: I took 164 with Hilfinger and I thought that was much harder than 162. That being said you should take 162. It’s good to know how OS works as a SWE.  Some people may say you’ll never use the information, but if you want to work on infra at Google or FB you’ll need to know this stuff very well.

Depending on when you took CS164, it may differ. If you did it with ChocoPy then 164 is much easier; any time before that and 164  might be the hardest programming class at Berkeley.

162 is great for learning about a new type of system, one that everyone uses everyday. It is also one of only a few classes with a heavy emphasis in concurrency at Berkeley. I would highly recommend taking it.

history.content:
Has anyone taken 162 after 164? I took 164 with Sen, found the workload to be pretty moderate and more stressful at project due dates but otherwise fine. I'm going into full-time SWE after graduation, would it still be worth it to take 162 if I have space? I've already had experience with long term group projects in 164 which is the main reason I'm asking.

Techs taken so far, if relevant: 61a/b/c,16a/b, 70, 170, 161, 164, 188, data100
history.subject: 162 after 164?
